episode_title: 618 - The One Where Ross Dates A Student

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! I just got uh, my teacher evaluations! Check out what this one student wrote, “I loved Dr. Geller’s class. Mind blowing lectures! Dr. Geller, you are definitely the hottie of the paleontology department!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, Hotties of the Paleontology Department, there’s a big selling calendar, eh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who wrote it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I wish I knew, but the evaluations are all anonymous.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey, do you still have their final exams?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ‘cause you can just match the evaluation to the exam with the same handwriting and boom, there’s your admirer. (Ross is stunned.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A hot girl’s at stake and all of the sudden he’s Rain Man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, why are we so sure that this is a girl?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a girl! Anyway, it wou—it wouldn’t matter. Okay? Because I’m a teacher and she’s a student.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, is that against the rules?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but it is frowned upon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Besides, there’s a big age difference.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well think of it like this, when you’re 90…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know when I’m 90 she’ll be like 80 and it won’t seem like such a big difference.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No that’s not what I was going to say at all. No, what I was going to say is when you’re 90 you’ll still have the memory of what it was like to be with a 20-year-old.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are eating breakfast as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Chandler! Y’know that girl you went to college with who-who became a movie director?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, Dana Keystone. She was in my Movement class.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s a Movement class?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Chandler’s way of pretending he didn’t take mime.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well listen, anyway she’s directing the new Al Pacino movie. You gotta get me an audition!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I don’t know man. I haven’t talked to her in like ten years.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, please-please Chandler I-I-I would owe you so much!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You do owe me so much. You owe me three thousand, four hundred…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey dude, why are you changing the subject? Why? Will you make the call or what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh okay, I’ll-I’ll try.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Thanks! You’re the best! Now listen, the last day of auditions is Thursday. Okay? So I gotta get in there by Thursday. Okay? Just remember Thursday. Thursday. Can you remember Thursday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah so, Tuesday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thursday! Look if you need help remembering think of like this, the third day. All right? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when? Huh? What day? Thursday! The third day! Okay?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mon? I’m gonna check my messages.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You just thought of that in there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah sure, nature called, she wanted to see who else did.
(Rachel dials her number.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? (Shocked that someone answered.) Uh, Rachel. (To the gang.) Great, someone is in our apartment. Call the cops!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re on the phone!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! Thank you! (Hangs up) That was the fire department, there was a fire at our place!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! How bad was it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, he didn’t say, but it was a fire. I’m guessing not very good. Come on, we gotta go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! (The girls all run out and Joey holds up Chandler by smiling.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you smiling about? What is so funny?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The part I want to audition for is a fireman, this is so meant to be!

content.description: N.Y.U. Paleontology department, Ross is putting up the grades on the message board.

content.speaker: Burt
content.text: Wow! It looks like you were very generous with your grades this semester! (Ross frantically starts to change some as a female student, Elizabeth, approaches.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Professor Geller?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I wanted to say how much I enjoyed your class.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh thank you. Thanks very much. (Leans up against the board and on a thumbtack.) Ow! (He pulls away.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Uh, I’m a little embarrassed about calling you a hottie on my evaluation…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was you?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah. I felt a little weird about it. You’re a teacher. I’m a student. But would you maybe want to go out with me sometime?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I, I don’t-I don’t think that would be the best idea.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh, because I was thinking, the semester’s over; you’re not my teacher anymore.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What time?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh, y’know what? Forget it, you already gave me an A.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gotcha. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: I’m kidding!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! So-so seriously, what time?

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, everyone minus Ross are arriving to inspect the damage. The fire department is still there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Coming through! (Has to dodge a fireman) Oh! Coming through! (Sees a cute one.) Oh! Hello! Hi! (Smiles then realizes) No! Right! Coming through!
(They start to look around seeing that the living room is undamaged.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh well, it’s not so bad.

content.speaker: Fireman #1
content.text: Yeah, most of the damage is pretty mostly contained in the bedrooms.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My God! (They both run into the bedrooms.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey buddy, do you think I can borrow your uniform this Thursday?

content.speaker: Fireman #1
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey! He’s working! (To Chandler) You would look good in that.
(Phoebe and Rachel return)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, how bad is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s bad. It’s really bad. The only thing in there that isn’t burned is an ass. Which I do not remember buying!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How’s your room Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Everything’s ruined. My bed. My clothes. Look at my favorite blue sweater. (Hold it up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Isn’t that mine?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine! I’m sorry for your loss! (Hands it back to her.)

content.speaker: Fireman #1
content.text: So uh, you’re not gonna be able to live here for a while, you ladies have a place to stay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Oh-okay, look pal, I am not in the mood to be hit on right now! But if you give me your number I will call you some other time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, they can stay with us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Have you figured out what started the fire Mr. Fireman?

content.speaker: Fireman #1
content.text: Well uh, do either of you smoke?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, not usually. But yeah, I could use one right now.

content.speaker: Fireman #1
content.text: No-no-no, do you uh light candles? Burn incense?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! I do! All the time! I love them! Oh my God! I did it! It’s me! It’s me! I burned down the house! I burned down the house!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Phoebe calm down, there’s no need to place blame. Okay? (To the fireman) I warned her about those candles.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is on the phone as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God, it’s great to catch up! I can’t believe how long it’s been!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, is that… (Mimes someone using a movie camera and Chandler nods yes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great! Good for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey listen… (Chandler waves him away.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! So yeah, maybe we can get together umm… (Joey mimes throwing something in the air, catching it, rolling it out, putting it in an oven and cutting it.) Can you hold for one second please? (To Joey) What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When you’re off the phone, do you wanna get a pizza?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! I’m back. (Goes to hang up the phone.) Yeah, that sounds great. (Listens) Okay. Well, we’ll do it then. (Listens) Okay, bye-bye. (He hangs up the phone and turns around to see Joey standing close to him and screams.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey listen, so when’s-when’s my audition? I mean I know it’s Thursday, but what time?
(Monica enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We didn’t get to the audition. I’m gonna take her to coffee and then we’ll do it then.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah-ha!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! So, now you’re going on a date with this girl?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, it is not a date! I haven’t talked to her in ten years! You can’t just call up somebody you haven’t talked to in ten years and ask them for a favor. There are rules, y’know? You gotta, you got to put in some time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re right, I’m sorry. It’s not like you’re y’know, going out with an ex-girlfriend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we only went out once.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You dated her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not once!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, well why don’t I go out with an ex-boyfriend and do Joey a favor?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you wanna do Joey a favor, maybe you go out with Joey. (He turns around to see Chandler glaring at him.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is having coffee with Dana.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great, my friend Joey’s in the movie business.

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Y’know who I ran into from school? Howie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My friend’s name is Joey.

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Apparently Howie’s editing now. Yeah, he-he-he calls me up and asks me if he can edit my new movie. Can you believe that?! Y’know I-I-I haven’t spoken to him in like ten years and he asks me for a favor!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’ve always hated that Howie.

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: No, no “How you doing?” Man, I mean not even a cup of coffee first!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The nerve huh?

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Refill?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is about to debut Hotel Monica (formerly known as Rachel’s Room) to Phoebe and Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, this is last minute so I want to apologize for the mess. Okay?
(They walk into a completely redecorated and repainted room. And of course, the room is immaculate. Only an obsessive-compulsive like Monica could find fault with the room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! It sure didn’t look this way when I lived here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! Now look, there’s only one problem though. There’s only room for one, so I guess one of you will have to stay at Joey’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, since the fire was kinda my fault I guess (To Rachel) you should get to stay here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey-hey, now this was no one’s fault Pheebs. Okay? It was an accident.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well no, it was my fault so you should get the nice room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (She jumps on the bed.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So Rach! You’re the first guest at Hotel Monica! Umm, you’ll just have to tell me how you like your eggs in the morning. And I thought I would bring them to you, y’know, in bed. Oh, you have been through so much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have.

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey is showing Phoebe around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This right here is where I keep the pizza. (He points to the chair.) And uh that’s where the napkin is. (Points to the floor next to the chair.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s that smell?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! (Shrugs his shoulders.)

content.description: A street, Ross is walking with Elizabeth on their date.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh please! It was such a big class! You never even noticed me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Of course I did! You uh, you sat next to Sleepy Sleeperson.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh uh, I had trouble remembering everyone’s name, so I-I kinda came up with nicknames. Like the guy on the other side of you was Smelly von Brownshirt.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Oh yeah. So umm, did you have a nickname for me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, no. No.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yes you did! What was it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, it’s Cutie McPretty.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ohh that’s so sweet!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I gotta tell ya, I-I’m having a great time! Y’know how before you said it might be weird, the whole student teacher thing, and to be frank I thought it would be too, but it’s not. I mean it’s not at all.

content.speaker: Burt
content.text: Dr. Geller!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Burt!

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Rachel are cleaning up the mess.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So did you sleep well last night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did, Monica was so sweet she left a little mint on my pillow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what Joey left on my pillow?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Gum!

content.speaker: Fireman #2
content.text: Well, we determined the cause of the fire.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I know, it was my candle. My candle!

content.speaker: Fireman #2
content.text: No, there was an appliance left on in the bathroom. It’s looks like a curling iron.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t use a curling iron.

content.speaker: Fireman #2
content.text: Well someone does.
(Phoebe looks at Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, don’t look at me! My hair’s straight! Straight! Straight! Straight!

content.speaker: Fireman #2
content.text: It could’ve been a hair straightener.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey is now showing Rachel around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is where I keep the pizza. (It’s the same location as before.) And—Hey! Where did the napkin go?! (The napkin is not in it’s spot.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe is reading and Monica runs over and turns on the lamp behind Phoebe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now there you go! I wouldn’t want my best guest to strain her eyes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does that smell bother you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What the smell from Joey’s? No, I can hardly smell it over here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well you let me know if you can, because y’know I can bake a pie to cover it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can smell it a little, bake the pie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Oh yes, one minute please. (To Phoebe) It’s for you. It’s the fire inspector.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (Takes the phone.) Hello? (Listens) Yeah this is Phoebe. (Listens) Really?!
[Cut to Joey’s, he’s on the phone.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, so it turns out that it wasn’t the hair straightener that started the fire. (Rachel prompts him on what to say next.) No-no, it was the candles. It’s very not good leaving candles unattended. In fact, one of the first things they teach you in fire school is… (Phoebe suddenly enters.) Uhh… Uhh… Okay. Well, I have to go now. (Phoebe leaves.)

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Ross is telling Monica and Joey about his date with Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We had such a great time! She’s-she’s incredible! I thought the-the age difference might be a problem, but it wasn’t. It wasn’t at all. Elizabeth is very mature for her age. (Joey makes the international sign for big boobies.) (To Monica) A concept lost on some people!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So it’s okay to date a student.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, not really. I mean technically it’s-it’s not against the rules or anything, but it is frowned upon. Especially by that professor we ran into last night, Judgey von Holierthanthou.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well Ross, you be careful now. You don’t want to get a reputation as y’know Professor McNailshisstudents.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. What-what should I do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well Ross, it seems pretty clear. I mean what’s more important? What people think or how you feel, huh? Ross, you gotta follow your heart.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey that is so sweet.
(He turns his back to Monica and does the international sign for big boobies again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey! So, how did it go with Dana? Any reason I should leave a block of time open say Thursday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I couldn’t do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You couldn’t do it?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, relax I just need more time. We’re going to dinner tonight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You’re going out with her again!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Going out with who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Dana Keystone from college.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah! Wasn’t she uh… (Does the international sign for big boobies.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, that was Dana Caplin.

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Ohhhh! (They all look up in a moment of reflection.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey! You didn’t even know her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah whatever!

content.description: A Restaurant, Chandler is having dinner with Dana.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great story again! The yarns that you weave! Woo-hoo-hoo!

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Y’know uh, actually I-I-I should get going.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no! Stay! Stay! Because you-you should you-you-you should stay!

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Wow. Oh, I am really flattered, but I just I don’t feel that way about you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, that’s not—No-no-no!

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: I’m sorry Chandler, y’know you are such a sweet guy and I, I don’t want to hurt you. Oh, I wish there was something I can do to make you feel better.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no—Really?!

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Of course!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it just hurts so bad. I uh…

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Ohh, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well maybe there is one thing you can do.

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: What?! Anything! Anything!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I umm, I mean this is just off the top of my head now, umm but I have this friend. This actor friend and he would kill me if he thought I was doing this umm, but umm would it be possible for him to get an audition for your movie say on Thursday?

content.speaker: Dana
content.text: Absolutely! But you-you would really feel better about me rejecting you if your actor friend can audition for my movie?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, the heart wants what it wants. I’ll see you later. (He runs off and leaves her with the bill, which the waiter promptly delivers.)

content.description: Hotel Monica, Phoebe is on the bed playing her guitar as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How’s it goin’?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, not much has changed in the last five minutes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes it has! I made cookies!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s all right. I’m still full from your homemade potato chips.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But you should eat them now because they’re hot from the oven.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Reaches for one.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-ho! But not in here! Can’t eat ‘em in bed, remember? No crumbies!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’ll be out in a second.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!
(Monica leaves and Phoebe closes the door behind her and tries to lock it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That doesn’t lock does it?

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey and Rachel are eating spaghetti in the living room while watching TV and Rachel drops some on the floor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Joey! Sorry!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No that’s all right. Don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach! Hey! It’s fine! You’re at Joey’s!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Look! (He throws some of his spaghetti on the floor.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve never lived like this before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know.
(Rachel throws some of hers down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, don’t waste it, I mean its still food. (He picks it up and eats it.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Elizabeth are deciding what to do on their second date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you want to do now? Huh? You wanna go get a drink?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Uhh, I can’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you have some studying to do?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: No, I have some turning 21 to do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know I remember when uh, when I was in college, we used to… (He sees some of his colleagues enter and puts his head on her lap.)

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing, I’m-I’m just, I’m so comfortable with you!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Do you not want to be seen with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? No! Of course, of course I do! Are-are they gone?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Uh no, they’re still here but I think I’m about to leave.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! No! No! Wait! You’re right, this is stupid. Who cares what people think? I mean, I mean we like each other right? There’s nothing wrong with that. Come on. (They get up and go over to the table where his colleagues are sitting.) Burt? Lydia? Mel? This is Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Aren’t you in my Popular Culture class?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right Lydia, Elizabeth here is a student and uh, we’re dating. And you may frown upon that, but we’re not gonna hide it anymore.

content.speaker: Mel
content.text: You are so fired.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Burt
content.text: They’re gonna fire you! You can’t date a student! It’s against the rules.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? Its not just frowned upon?

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey and Rachel are throwing huge spitballs at the entertainment center.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I love it at Joey’s!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, here you go. (Hands her another one.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ni-hi-ice!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you busy Thursday?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, very funny. I don’t know if you remember, but my audition was supposed to be Thursday. (Chandler doesn’t say anything until Joey figures it out.) You got me the audition?! Let’s hug it up! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Okay. (Joey puts him down.) What are you gonna do to me if you get the part?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen umm, yeah okay, I need to talk to you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now I know that they said that the umm, the hair straightener started the fire but I think I’m partly at fault. You see, I didn’t, I didn’t tell you but umm, but I-I had recently refilled the tissues and so y’know let’s just face it, that’s just kindling! So I think it’s better that I stay at Joey’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no-no-no. Phoebe, this was my fault and besides y’know what? I’m fine here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Oh umm, Chandler, Monica is looking for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah she said something about crumbies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No! I was so careful! (Runs out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you have to switch with me! Monica is driving me crazy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right, all the ladies want to stay at Joey’s.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No! Phoebe, come on! I don’t want to switch! Please come on! I can throw wet paper towels here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No but at Monica’s you can eat cookies over the sink!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right fine! This looks like so much fun. (Examining the bowl of wet paper towels.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, what a mess. (She grabs the bowl and heads for Monica’s.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is looking at his handbook. Elizabeth is also there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! It actually is in the handbook. I can’t date you or have a hot plate in my office. I can’t believe we have to stop seeing each other.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: For what it’s worth I did appreciate you standing up for me. It felt really nice. It kinda made me like you even more.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, I know I really like you too. But we-we can’t date. It’s against the rules. It’s forbidden.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Just hearing you describe it as forbidden, it’s really hot.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I-I-I don’t care how hot it is it’s-it’s uh, it’s wrong.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Stop it! (She starts to get all worked up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! It’s wrong! It’s-it’s-it’s naughty. It’s taboo.

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Shut the book!
(They frantically start making out.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s also get a hot plate!
(They start making out again.)

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey is eating pizza as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s Thursday! How was the audition?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wh? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when huh what? Thurs—(He gasps in horror.) Oh! (Runs out and Chandler just shakes his head. After a second Joey runs back in to grab a piece of pizza and runs back out.)
